description: Borrowed from Late Latin indigenus (“native, born in a country”), from indi- (indu-), an old derivative of in (“in”), gen- the root of gignō (“give birth to”), and English -ous. Compare indigene, Ancient Greek ἐνδογενής (endogenḗs, “born in the house”), and the separately formed endogenous.

definitionGroups.group: Born or originating in, native to a land or region, especially before an intrusion. [from 17th c.]

entries.meaning: In particular, of or relating to a people (or their language or culture) that inhabited a region prior to the arrival of people of other cultures which became dominant (e.g., through colonialism), and which maintains a distinct culture.
examples: The Ainu are the indigenous ethnic group of Japan's Hokkaido Island.
He had all the tricks of a newspaper boy indigenous in him.
